intro: Chelidonium majus var. crenatum, commonly known as the crenate greater celandine, is a variant of the greater celandine plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae, characterized by its yellow flowers and lobed leaves. The plant contains alkaloids, which make it toxic and potentially harmful if ingested. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a distinctive, branching stem with alternate leaves.
